page.title: 11Food and Holidays,Brickhill
page.content: From the survey, it was clear that most families did a big weekly shop in the town supermarkets and only bought small amounts locally. The pattern of family meals varied considerably except that nearly every child (5-9yr) had lunch at school. The family meals at home varied from the whole family having an evening meal at approximately 6.30 p.m. to each person having a snack or meal as they arrived back in the evening. The number of family members preferring traditional English fare, convenience foods or foreign dishes were nearly the same and most families preferred a mixture of all types of cooking. Family holidays also varied in type and their frequency was:- {One per annum.....28;Two per annum..59 {Three per annum...25;Four per annum..4
